availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Washington Norton (Russellville, Kentucky, banker and financier)

body.p: Russellville, Kentucky, banker and financier. Logan County, Kentucky, native. Son of William Norton and Mary Hise Norton. Married to Martha Henry Norton in 1856. Father of Ernest Norton, Juliette Norton, Mary Norton, Susan Norton, and Lucy Norton. Dry good merchant in Logan County. Founder and president of the Southern Bank in Russellville from 1850 to 1866. Owned five enslaved persons in 1850 and eight in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, Russellville, p. 65A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, Russellville.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, Russellville, p. 25.
Find A Grave, "George Washington Norton (1815-1889), Memorial #14838616, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/14838616/george-washington-norton (accessed January 8, 2017).
Samuel W. Thomas, "Norton, George Washington," in The Encyclopedia of Louisville, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: The University Press of Kentucky, 2001), 659-660.
"George W. Norton Dead: one of Louisville's Weathiest Citizens Expires Early this Morning," _Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), July 18, 1889, p. 6.
